:hand-pink-waving::hand-pink-waving::hand-pink-waving::hand-pink-waving:
Routers use IP addresses to forward data across the networks. Inside a LAN, devices rely on MAC addresses.But for communicating with a device that is outside of this LAN requires an IP address.

MAC addresses are not unique and cannot be unique as there are not enough bits in a MAC address to guarantee uniqueness . A MAC address can be changed . This is used when you get two devices on a local network with the same MAC address. You cannot have two devices on the same local network with the same MAC address for obvious reasons.
